segments.pli: “‘So vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kañci saṅkhāraṃ niccato samanupassanto anulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato bhavissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, it’s totally impossible for a mendicant who regards any condition as permanent to accept views that agree with the teaching.

segments.pli: ‘Anulomikāya khantiyā asamannāgato sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: Without accepting views that agree with the teaching, it’s impossible to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.

segments.pli: ‘Sammattaniyāmaṃ anokkamamāno sotāpattiphalaṃ vā sakadāgāmiphalaṃ vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arahattaṃ vā sacchikarissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: Without entering the sure path, it’s impossible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.

segments.pli: ‘So vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sabbasaṅkhāre aniccato samanupassanto anulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato bhavissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: It’s totally possible for a mendicant who regards all conditions as impermanent to accept views that agree with the teaching.

segments.pli: ‘Anulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: Having accepted views that agree with the teaching, it’s possible to enter the sure path.

segments.pli: ‘Sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamamāno sotāpattiphalaṃ vā sakadāgāmiphalaṃ vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arahattaṃ vā sacchikarissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
segments.en: Having entered the sure path, it’s possible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.”
